page.title: 01Cramlington:Introduction
page.content: Cramlington has been here since about 900 A.D. It was named after KRAM or KRAMEL, a Danish chief,or thegn, and means Kramel's Town. Now it is a busy, pleasant town of some 30,000 inhabitants, about 8 miles north of Newcastle, and in the County of Northumberland. Cramlington is a new town and was built because there was space near to the main railway line, near to Newcastle airport and near to good main roads. Lots of people came to live here from Tyneside. There are lots of big new factories where people work. Many people travel to work outside Cramlington, mainly in Newcastle.
